title: Kayal Iro
text:
Kayal Iro (born February 20, 2000) is a <a href="Cook%20Islands%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Cook Islands</a> international <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who plays as a and er for the <a href="Cronulla-Sutherland%20Sharks">Cronulla-Sutherland Sharks</a> in the <a href="National%20Rugby%20League">NRL</a>.
Background.
Iro is the son of former player <a href="Kevin%20Iro">Kevin Iro</a> and nephew of coach <a href="Tony%20Iro">Tony Iro</a>. He grew up in <a href="Rarotonga">Rarotonga</a> where he played for the Arorangi Bears, then moved to Auckland at age 14 and attended <a href="Mount%20Albert%20Grammar%20School">Mount Albert Grammar School</a>.
Playing career.
New Zealand Warriors.
In 2019, Iro played for the <a href="New%20Zealand%20Warriors">New Zealand Warriors</a> under 20s, before moving to the <a href="Newcastle%20Knights">Newcastle Knights</a>.
Newcastle Knights.
On 12 November 2019, Iro signed a one-year under 20s contract with the <a href="Newcastle%20Knights">Newcastle Knights</a>.
International.
Iro represented the <a href="Cook%20Islands%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Cook Islands</a> in the <a href="2019%20Rugby%20League%20World%20Cup%209s">2019 Rugby League World Cup 9s</a>, scoring two tries in a 30–7 victory against <a href="Tonga%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Tonga</a>. 
He made his full international début in the 66–6 win over <a href="South%20Africa%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">South Africa</a> on 21 June 2019 at .
